content: this colorful tote is a perfect example of the little things that can be tweaked in a project this bag first appeared in the spring 2007 issue in a dk-weight merino yarn mercerized cotton breathes new life into this updated design check out this fresh take on a wonderful tote **difficulty** intermediate **yarn weight** 3 **finished size** 22 wide 14 high and 4 deep excluding strap **yarn from interweave crochet spring 2020** omega sinfonia distributed by creative yarn source 100% mercerized cotton 218 yd 200 m / 3½ oz 100 g #887 charcoal mc 2 balls #837 dark magenta #817 light teal #816 teal #809 green mist #885 pale rose #805 brick #806 light gold 1 ball each **hook** size h/8 5 mm adjust hook size if necessary to obtain the correct gauge **notions** yarn needle 45 wide fabric 1 1⁄8 yd length sewing needle and coordinating thread 18 zipper 1 **gauge** 16 single_crochet = 4 block = 6½ square for techniques you don t know please visit our online crochet glossary at https //www interweave com/interweave-crochet-glossary/ 1 **notes** * each block motif consists of three colors a for the center b for the middle and c for the outside * choose any color combination you like for each block changing colors on rounds 3 and 6 for more information see https //www interweave com/store/interweave-crochet-spring-2020-digital-edition 2 **from interweave crochet spring 2007** block = 6 1/2 square k1220 rusty red mc - 3 skeins k1515 blue cc - 1 skein k0000 white cc - 1 skein k1520 lime green cc - 1 skein k2370 apricot cc - 1 skein k2260 purple cc - 1 skein k1141 pink cc - 1 skein k1125 rose cc - 1 skein also needed 1 1/8 yd of 45 wide fabric for lining matching thread 18 zipper sharp sewing needle yarn needle 1 https //www interweave com/interweave-crochet-glossary/ 2 https //www interweave com/store/interweave-crochet-spring-2020-digital-edition
